mockData.response: ["apple",["Apple","Apple Inc.","Apple Records","Apple II series","Appletons' Cyclop\u00e6dia of American Biography","Apple II","Appleton, Wisconsin","Apple pie","Apple TV","Apple Music"],["An apple is a sweet, edible fruit produced by an apple tree (Malus pumila). Apple trees are cultivated worldwide as a fruit tree, and is the most widely grown species in the genus Malus.","Apple Inc. is an American multinational technology company headquartered in Cupertino, California, that designs, develops, and sells consumer electronics, computer software, and online services.","Apple Records is a record label founded by the Beatles in 1968, as a division of Apple Corps Ltd. It was initially intended as a creative outlet for the Beatles, both as a group and individually, plus a selection of other artists including Mary Hopkin, James Taylor, Badfinger, and Billy Preston.","The Apple II series (trademarked with square brackets as \"Apple ][\" and rendered on later models as \"Apple //\") is a family of home computers, one of the first highly successful mass-produced text command microcomputer products, designed primarily by Steve Wozniak, manufactured by Apple Computer (now Apple Inc.) and introduced in 1977 with the original Apple II.","Appletons' Cyclop\u00e6dia of American Biography is a six-volume collection of biographies of notable people involved in the history of the New World.","The Apple II (stylized as Apple ][) is an 8-bit home computer, one of the first highly successful mass-produced microcomputer products, designed primarily by Steve Wozniak (Steve Jobs oversaw the development of the Apple II's foam-molded plastic case and Rod Holt developed the switching power supply).","Appleton is a city in Outagamie (mostly), Calumet, and Winnebago counties in the U.S. state of Wisconsin.","An apple pie is a pie or a tart, in which the principal filling ingredient is apple. It is, on occasion, served with whipped cream or ice cream on top, or alongside cheddar cheese.","Apple TV is a digital media player and microconsole developed and sold by Apple Inc. It is a small network appliance and entertainment device that can receive digital data from a number of sources and stream it to a capable television.","Apple Music is a music and video streaming service developed by Apple Inc. Users select music to stream to their device on-demand, or they can listen to existing, curated playlists."],["https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple_Inc.","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple_Records","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple_II_series","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Appletons%27_Cyclop%C3%A6dia_of_American_Biography","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple_II","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Appleton,_Wisconsin","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple_pie","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple_TV","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple_Music"]]

["love",["Love","Loveland, Colorado","Lovejoy Glacier","Loves Park, Illinois","Lovecraftian horror","Love the Way You Lie","Love's Labour's Lost","Lovell Augustus Reeve","Love triangle","Love Hina"],["Love encompasses a variety of different emotional and mental states, typically strongly and positively experienced, ranging from the deepest interpersonal affection to the simplest pleasure.","The City of Loveland is the Home Rule Municipality that is the second most populous municipality in Larimer County, Colorado, United States.","Lovejoy Glacier (70\u00b048\u2032S 160\u00b010\u2032E) is a broad glacier descending eastward through the Usarp Mountains of Antarctica between Anderson Pyramid and the Sample Nunataks.","Loves Park is a city in Boone and Winnebago counties in the U.S. state of Illinois. The population was 23,996 at the 2010 census, up from 20,044 in 2000.","Lovecraftian horror is a subgenre of horror fiction that emphasizes the cosmic horror of the unknown (and in some cases, unknowable) more than gore or other elements of shock, though these may still be present.","\"Love the Way You Lie\" is a song recorded by the American rapper Eminem, featuring Barbadian singer Rihanna, from Eminem's seventh studio album Recovery (2010).","Love's Labour's Lost is one of William Shakespeare's early comedies, believed to have been written in the mid-1590s for a performance at the Inns of Court before Queen Elizabeth I.","Lovell Augustus Reeve (19 April 1814 \u2013 18 November 1865) was an English conchologist and publisher.","A love triangle (also called a romantic love triangle or a romance triangle or an eternal triangle) is usually a romantic relationship involving three people.","Love Hina (Japanese: \u30e9\u30d6 \u3072\u306a, Hepburn: Rabu Hina) is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by Ken Akamatsu."],["https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Love","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loveland,_Colorado","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lovejoy_Glacier","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loves_Park,_Illinois","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lovecraftian_horror","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Love_the_Way_You_Lie","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Love%27s_Labour%27s_Lost","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lovell_Augustus_Reeve","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Love_triangle","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Love_Hina"]]

["germany",["Germany","Germany national football team","Germany at the 1992 Summer Olympics","Germany women's national football team","Germany national youth football team","Germany at the 1936 Summer Olympics","Germany at the 1996 Summer Olympics","Germany in the Eurovision Song Contest","Germany at the 2012 Summer Olympics","Germany national under-21 football team"],["Germany (German: Deutschland [\u02c8d\u0254\u028ft\u0283lant]), officially the Federal Republic of Germany (German: Bundesrepublik Deutschland, listen ), is a federal parliamentary republic in central-western Europe.","The Germany national football team (German: Die deutsche Fu\u00dfballnationalmannschaft or just Die Mannschaft) is the men's football team that has represented Germany in international competition since 1908. It is governed by the German Football Association (Deutscher Fu\u00dfball-Bund), founded in 1900. Ever since the DFB was reinaugurated in 1949 the team has represented the Federal Republic of Germany.","Germany competed at the 1992 Summer Olympics in Barcelona, Spain. It was the first time the European nation participated after German reunification in 1990. Previously, West Germany and East Germany had sent independent teams to the Games.","The Germany women's national football team (German: Deutsche Fu\u00dfballnationalmannschaft der Frauen) is governed by the German Football Association (DFB).","This article includes current squads of Germany U-19, U-18, U-17, U-16 and U-15 national football teams.","Germany was the host nation and top medal recipient for the 1936 Summer Olympics in Berlin. 433 competitors, 389 men and 44 women, took part in 143 events in 22 sports.","Germany competed at the 1996 Summer Olympics in Atlanta, United States. 465 competitors, 278 men and 187 women, took part in 234 events in 26 sports.","Germany has officially participated in every Eurovision Song Contest since its beginning in 1956, except in 1996 when its entry did not qualify past the audio-only pre\u2010selection round, and consequently was not seen in the broadcast final and does not count as one of Germany's 61 appearances.","Germany competed at the 2012 Summer Olympics in London, from 27 July to 12 August 2012. This was the nation's sixth consecutive appearance at the Summer Olympics after its reunification in 1990. The German National Olympic Committee (German: Deutscher Olympischer Sportbund, DOSB) sent the nation's smallest delegation to the Games since its reunification.","The Germany national under-21 football team represents the under-21s of Germany in the UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship and is controlled by the German Football Association (DFB), the governing body of football in Germany."],["https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_national_football_team","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_at_the_1992_Summer_Olympics","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_women%27s_national_football_team","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_national_youth_football_team","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_at_the_1936_Summer_Olympics","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_at_the_1996_Summer_Olympics","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_in_the_Eurovision_Song_Contest","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_at_the_2012_Summer_Olympics","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_national_under-21_football_team"]]

["Donald trump",["Donald Trump","Donald Trump presidential campaign, 2016","Donald Trump speech to joint session of Congress, February 2017","Donald Trump Jr.","Donald Trump (Last Week Tonight)","Donald Trump on social media","Donald Trump Access Hollywood tape","Donald Trump presidential campaign, 2000","Donald Trump Supreme Court candidates","Donald Trump presidential campaign, 2020"],["Donald John Trump (born June 14, 1946) is the 45th and current President of the United States, in office since January 20, 2017. Before entering politics, he was a businessman and television personality.","The 2016 presidential campaign of Donald Trump was formally launched on June 16, 2015, at Trump Tower in New York City.","The 45th President of the United States, Donald Trump, gave his first public address before a joint session of the United States Congress on Tuesday, February 28, 2017. Similar to a State of the Union address, it was delivered before the 115th United States Congress in the Chamber of the United States House of Representatives in the United States Capitol.","Donald John Trump Jr. (born December 31, 1977) is an American businessman and former reality television personality.","\"Donald Trump\" is a segment of the award-winning HBO news satire television series Last Week Tonight with John Oliver that is devoted to Donald Trump, who later became the President of the United States.","The presence of Donald Trump on social media has attracted attention worldwide. The main coverage has been about his tweets about various subjects, after he joined social networking site Twitter in March 2009. Trump has frequently used Twitter and other social media platforms to make comments about other politicians, celebrities and daily news.","On October 7, 2016, during the 2016 United States presidential election, The Washington Post published a video and accompanying article about then-presidential candidate Donald Trump and television host Billy Bush having \"an extremely lewd conversation about women\" in 2005. Trump and Bush were in a bus on their way to film an episode of Access Hollywood (now Access), a show owned by NBCUniversal.","Donald Trump's presidential campaign of 2000 for the nomination of the Reform Party began when real estate magnate Donald Trump of New York announced the creation of a presidential exploratory committee on the October 7, 1999 edition of Larry King Live.","With the advice and consent of the United States Senate, the President of the United States appoints the members of the Supreme Court of the United States, which is the highest court of the federal judiciary of the United States.","The 2020 Donald Trump presidential campaign is an ongoing re-election campaign by President of the United States Donald Trump, who took office on January 20, 2017."],["https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump_presidential_campaign,_2016","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump_speech_to_joint_session_of_Congress,_February_2017","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump_Jr.","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump_(Last_Week_Tonight)","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump_on_social_media","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump_Access_Hollywood_tape","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump_presidential_campaign,_2000","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump_Supreme_Court_candidates","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump_presidential_campaign,_2020"]]

["Elon Musk",["Elon Musk","Elon Musk's Tesla Roadster","Elon Musk: Tesla, SpaceX, and the Quest for a Fantastic Future","Elon Musk' Los Angeles tunnel boring machine project"],["Elon Reeve Musk (; born June 28, 1971) is a South African-born Canadian American business magnate, investor, and engineer.","Elon Musk's Tesla Roadster is an electric sports car that was the dummy payload for the Falcon Heavy test flight in February 2018. Starman, a mannequin dressed in a spacesuit, occupies the driver's seat.","Elon Musk: Tesla, SpaceX, and the Quest for a Fantastic Future is Ashlee Vance's biography of Elon Musk, published in 2015. The book traces Elon Musk's life from his childhood up to the time he spent at Zip2 and PayPal, and then onto SpaceX, Tesla, and SolarCity.",""],["https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elon_Musk","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elon_Musk%27s_Tesla_Roadster","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elon_Musk:_Tesla,_SpaceX,_and_the_Quest_for_a_Fantastic_Future","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elon_Musk%27_Los_Angeles_tunnel_boring_machine_project"]]

["iron",["Iron","Iron Age","Iron Horse (magazine)","Iron Maiden","Iron Cross","Iron Man","Irony","Iron ore","Iron & Blood: Warriors of Ravenloft","Ironclad warship"],["Iron is a chemical element with symbol Fe (from Latin: ferrum) and atomic number 26. It is a metal in the first transition series.","The Iron Age is the final epoch of the three-age system, preceded by the Stone Age (Neolithic) and the Bronze Age.","Iron Horse, sometimes written Ironhorse, was a motorcycling magazine dedicated to biker culture, published between 1979 and 2011.","Iron Maiden are an English heavy metal band formed in Leyton, East London, in 1975 by bassist and primary songwriter Steve Harris.","The Iron Cross (German: Eisernes Kreuz , abbreviated EK) was a military decoration in the Kingdom of Prussia, and later in the German Empire (1871\u20131918) and Nazi Germany (1933\u20131945).","Iron Man is a fictional superhero appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics. The character was created by writer and editor Stan Lee, developed by scripter Larry Lieber, and designed by artists Don Heck and Jack Kirby.","Irony (from Ancient Greek \u03b5\u1f30\u03c1\u03c9\u03bd\u03b5\u03af\u03b1 eir\u014dne\u00eda, meaning 'dissimulation, feigned ignorance'), in its broadest sense, is a rhetorical device, literary technique, or event in which what appears, on the surface, to be the case, differs radically from what is actually the case.","Iron ores are rocks and minerals from which metallic iron can be economically extracted. The ores are usually rich in iron oxides and vary in colour from dark grey, bright yellow, or deep purple to rusty red.","Iron & Blood: Warriors of Ravenloft is a 3D fighting game released for PC and PlayStation.","An ironclad is a steam-propelled warship protected by iron or steel armor plates used in the early part of the second half of the 19th century."],["https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iron","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iron_Age","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iron_Horse_(magazine)","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iron_Maiden","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iron_Cross","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iron_Man","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Irony","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iron_ore","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iron_%26_Blood:_Warriors_of_Ravenloft","https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ironclad_warship"]]

["Lyudmila Putina",["Lyudmila Putina"],["Lyudmila Aleksandrovna Ocheretnaya, formerly Lyudmila Aleksandrovna Putina (Russian: \u041b\u044e\u0434\u043c\u0438\u0301\u043b\u0430 \u0410\u043b\u0435\u043a\u0441\u0430\u0301\u043d\u0434\u0440\u043e\u0432\u043d\u0430 \u041f\u0443\u0301\u0442\u0438\u043d\u0430, pronounced [l\u02b2\u028ad\u02c8m\u02b2i\u026b\u0259 \u0250l\u02b2\u026ak\u02c8sandr\u0259vn\u0259 \u02c8put\u02b2\u026an\u0259], n\u00e9e Shkrebneva, \u0428\u043a\u0440\u0435\u0431\u043d\u0435\u0432\u0430; born 6 January 1958), is the ex-wife of the President and former Prime Minister of Russia, Vladimir Putin."],["https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyudmila_Putina"]]

<SearchSuggestion version="2.0" xmlns="http://opensearch.org/searchsuggest2"><Query xml:space="preserve">Quintessence</Query><Section><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Quintessence</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quintessence</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Quintessence may refer to:</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Quintessence (physics)</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quintessence_(physics)</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">In physics, quintessence is a hypothetical form of dark energy, more precisely a scalar field, postulated as an explanation of the observation of an accelerating rate of expansion of the universe, rather than due to a true cosmological constant.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Quintessence (English band)</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quintessence_(English_band)</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Quintessence was a rock band formed in April 1969 in Notting Hill, London, England. Their style was a mixture of jazz, psychedelic rock and progressive rock with an influence of music from India.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Quintessence (horse)</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quintessence_(horse)</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Quintessence (1900–1917) was a British Thoroughbred racehorse who won the 1000 Guineas of 1903 and was unbeaten in her six races.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Quintessence Editions</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quintessence_Editions</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Quintessence Editions Ltd. is a publishing company based in London (UK) which is the originator of the "1001 Before You Die" series.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Quintessence (Bill Evans album)</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quintessence_(Bill_Evans_album)</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Quintessence is an album by American jazz pianist Bill Evans. It was recorded in 1976 for Fantasy Records and released the following year.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Quintessence (Borknagar album)</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quintessence_(Borknagar_album)</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Quintessence is the fourth studio album by Norwegian metal band Borknagar. It was recorded at The Abyss Studios in January 2000 and mixed by Peter Tägtgren.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Quintessence: The Search for Missing Mass in the Universe</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quintessence:_The_Search_for_Missing_Mass_in_the_Universe</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Quintessence: The Search for Missing Mass in the Universe is the fifth non-fiction book by the American theoretical physicist Lawrence M.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Quintessence (restaurant)</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quintessence_(restaurant)</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Quintessence is a Michelin 3-star Japanese French fusion restaurant in Shinagawa, Japan. It is difficult to reserve a table in the restaurant and has been listed as among the 50 best restaurants in Asia by CNN.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Quintessence of Ibsenism</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quintessence_of_Ibsenism</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">The Quintessence of Ibsenism is an essay written in 1891 by George Bernard Shaw, providing an extended analysis of the works of Norwegian playwright Henrik Ibsen and of Ibsen's critical reception in England.</Description></Item></Section></SearchSuggestion>

<SearchSuggestion version="2.0" xmlns="http://opensearch.org/searchsuggest2"><Query xml:space="preserve">Elon Musk</Query><Section><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Elon Musk</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elon_Musk</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Elon Reeve Musk (; born June 28, 1971) is a South African-born Canadian American business magnate, investor, and engineer.</Description><Image source="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Elon_Musk_2015.jpg/34px-Elon_Musk_2015.jpg" width="34" height="50" /></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Elon Musk's Tesla Roadster</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elon_Musk%27s_Tesla_Roadster</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Elon Musk's Tesla Roadster is an electric sports car that was the dummy payload for the Falcon Heavy test flight in February 2018. Starman, a mannequin dressed in a spacesuit, occupies the driver's seat.</Description><Image source="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1a/Elon_Musk%27s_Tesla_Roadster_%2840110297852%29.jpg/50px-Elon_Musk%27s_Tesla_Roadster_%2840110297852%29.jpg" width="50" height="28" /></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Elon Musk: Tesla, SpaceX, and the Quest for a Fantastic Future</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elon_Musk:_Tesla,_SpaceX,_and_the_Quest_for_a_Fantastic_Future</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Elon Musk: Tesla, SpaceX, and the Quest for a Fantastic Future is Ashlee Vance's biography of Elon Musk, published in 2015. The book traces Elon Musk's life from his childhood up to the time he spent at Zip2 and PayPal, and then onto SpaceX, Tesla, and SolarCity.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">The Boring Company</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Boring_Company</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">The Boring Company is an infrastructure and tunnel construction company founded by Elon Musk in late 2016. Musk has cited difficulty with Los Angeles traffic and limitations with the current 2-D transportation network as inspiration for the tunneling company project.</Description><Image source="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3b/The_Boring_Company_Logo.svg/50px-The_Boring_Company_Logo.svg.png" width="50" height="22" /></Item></Section></SearchSuggestion>

<SearchSuggestion version="2.0" xmlns="http://opensearch.org/searchsuggest2"><Query xml:space="preserve">Grimm</Query><Section><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Grimm</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grimm</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Grimm may refer to:</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Grimms' Fairy Tales</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grimms%27_Fairy_Tales</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Children's and Household Tales (from the German: Kinder- und Hausmärchen) is a collection of fairy tales first published on 20 December 1812 by the Grimm brothers or "Brothers Grimm", Jacob and Wilhelm.</Description><Image source="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8c/Grimm%27s_Kinder-_und_Hausm%C3%A4rchen%2C_Erster_Theil_%281812%29.cover.jpg/39px-Grimm%27s_Kinder-_und_Hausm%C3%A4rchen%2C_Erster_Theil_%281812%29.cover.jpg" width="39" height="50" /></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Grimm (TV series)</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grimm_(TV_series)</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Grimm is an American fantasy police procedural drama television series created by Stephen Carpenter and Jim Kouf & David Greenwalt and produced by Universal Television for NBC.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Grimm's law</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grimm%27s_law</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Grimm's law (also known as the First Germanic Sound Shift or Rask's rule) is a set of statements named after Jacob Grimm and Rasmus Rask describing the inherited Proto-Indo-European (PIE) stop consonants as they developed in Proto-Germanic (the common ancestor of the Germanic branch of the Indo-European family) in the 1st millennium BC.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Grimm's Fairy Tale Classics</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grimm%27s_Fairy_Tale_Classics</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Grimm's Fairy Tale Classics, also known as Grimm Masterpiece Theater in original version, is a Japanese anime anthology series by Nippon Animation.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Grimm's Snow White</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grimm%27s_Snow_White</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Grimm's Snow White is a 2012 American fantasy film produced by The Asylum and directed by Rachel Lee Goldenberg.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Grimma</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grimma</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Grimma is a town in the Free State of Saxony, Germany, on the left bank of the Mulde, 25 kilometres (16 mi) southeast of Leipzig.</Description><Image source="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e5/Grimma_Stadt.jpg/50px-Grimma_Stadt.jpg" width="50" height="38" /></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Grimme-Preis</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grimme-Preis</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">The Grimme-Preis ("Grimme Award"; and, prior to 2011: Adolf-Grimme-Preis) is a television award and one of the most prestigious awards for German television.</Description><Image source="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b8/Grimme-Preis-Logo_RGB_2011.jpg/50px-Grimme-Preis-Logo_RGB_2011.jpg" width="50" height="25" /></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Grimm (season 1)</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grimm_(season_1)</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">The first season of the NBC American supernatural drama series Grimm premiered on October 28, 2011, and concluded on May 18, 2012. It consisted of 22 episodes.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Grimmen</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grimmen</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Grimmen (German pronunciation: [ˈɡʁɪmən]) is a town in Vorpommern-Rügen, a district in the Bundesland Mecklenburg-Vorpommern, Germany.</Description><Image source="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ed/Germany_adm_location_map.svg/42px-Germany_adm_location_map.svg.png" width="42" height="50" /></Item></Section></SearchSuggestion>

<SearchSuggestion version="2.0" xmlns="http://opensearch.org/searchsuggest2"><Query xml:space="preserve">forecast</Query><Section><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Forecast</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forecast</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Forecast may refer to:</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Forecastle</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forecastle</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">The forecastle ( FOHK-səl; abbreviated fo'c'sle or fo'c's'le) is the upper deck of a sailing ship forward of the foremast, or the forward part of a ship with the sailors' living quarters.</Description><Image source="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d8/Mauritius_-_Detail_uit_Het_uitzeilen_van_een_aantal_Oost-Indi%C3%ABvaarders_van_Hendrick_Cornelisz_Vroom_%281600%29.jpg/50px-Mauritius_-_Detail_uit_Het_uitzeilen_van_een_aantal_Oost-Indi%C3%ABvaarders_van_Hendrick_Cornelisz_Vroom_%281600%29.jpg" width="50" height="38" /></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Forecasting</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forecasting</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Forecasting is the process of making predictions of the future based on past and present data and most commonly by analysis of trends.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Forecast bias</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forecast_bias</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">A forecast bias occurs when there are consistent differences between actual outcomes and previously generated forecasts of those quantities; that is: forecasts may have a general tendency to be too high or too low.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Forecast: Tomorrow</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forecast:_Tomorrow</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Forecast: Tomorrow is a 3-CD/1-DVD career-spanning compilation of recordings of Weather Report. The 37 tracks are presented chronologically, beginning with three tracks pre–Weather Report, from ensemble duties with Miles Davis (both Zawinul and Shorter), Cannonball Adderley (Zawinul), and from a Shorter solo album.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Forecastle Festival</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forecastle_Festival</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">The Forecastle Festival is a three-day music, art, and environmental activism festival held annually in Louisville, Kentucky, since 2002. The festival originated as a small gathering of local musicians in Louisville's Tyler Park, and steadily grew into a national attraction that now includes major touring acts, national art collectives, outdoor industry partners, prominent speakers, and more.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Forecast skill</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forecast_skill</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Forecast skill (or skill score, forecast skill, prediction skill) within the fields of forecasting and prediction is a generic term referring to the accuracy and/or degree of association of prediction to an observation or estimate of the actual value of what is being predicted (formally, the predictand).</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Forecast error</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forecast_error</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">In statistics, a forecast error is the difference between the actual or real and the predicted or forecast value of a time series or any other phenomenon of interest.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Forecast (808 State album)</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forecast_(808_State_album)</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Forecast is an compilation album by English electronic music group 808 State, which was released on 25 May 1993 by ZTT Records, exclusively in Japan.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Forecast region</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forecast_region</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">A forecast region is a unique geographical area for which individual weather reports are issued.</Description></Item></Section></SearchSuggestion>

<SearchSuggestion version="2.0" xmlns="http://opensearch.org/searchsuggest2"><Query xml:space="preserve">Putina</Query><Section><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Putina</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Putina</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Putina may refer to:</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Putina District</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Putina_District</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Putina District is one of five districts of the San Antonio de Putina Province in Peru.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Putina (town)</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Putina_(town)</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Putina is a town in southern Peru, capital of the province San Antonio de Putina in the region Puno.</Description><Image source="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7b/Peru_location_map.svg/41px-Peru_location_map.svg.png" width="41" height="50" /></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Putina River (Râușor)</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Putina_River_(R%C3%A2u%C8%99or)</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">The Putina River is a tributary of the Râuşor in Romania.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">Putina River (Bahlui)</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Putina_River_(Bahlui)</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">The Putina River is a tributary of the Bahlui River in Romania.</Description></Item><Item><Text xml:space="preserve">P. T. Narasimhachar</Text><Url xml:space="preserve">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/P._T._Narasimhachar</Url><Description xml:space="preserve">Purohita Thirunarayana Narasimhachar (17 March 1905 – 23 October 1998), commonly known as PuTiNa, was a playwright and poet in the Kannada language.</Description></Item></Section></SearchSuggestion>

Elon Musk: Tesla, SpaceX, and the Quest for a Fantastic Future is Ashlee Vance's biography of Elon Musk, published in 2015. The book traces Elon Musk's life from his childhood up to the time he spent at Zip2 and PayPal, and then onto SpaceX, Tesla, and SolarCity.

test-case.q: can you tell me who is sir Isaac Newton
test-case.a: Sir Isaac Newton was an English mathematician, astronomer, theologian, author and physicist who is widely recognised as one of the most influential scientists of all time, and a key figure in the scientific revolution.
Lyudmila Aleksandrovna Ocheretnaya, formerly Lyudmila Aleksandrovna Putina , is the ex-wife of the President and former Prime Minister of Russia, Vladimir Putin.
Putina may refer to:
Putina District is one of five districts of the San Antonio de Putina Province in Peru.
Putina is a town in southern Peru, capital of the province San Antonio de Putina in the region Puno.
Donald John Trump is the 45th and current President of the United States, in office since January 20, 2017. Before entering politics, he was a businessman and television personality.
Quintessence may refer to:

In physics, quintessence is a hypothetical form of dark energy, more precisely a scalar field, postulated as an explanation of the observation of an accelerating rate of expansion of the universe, rather than due to a true cosmological constant.
Quintessence was a rock band formed in April 1969 in Notting Hill, London, England. Their style was a mixture of jazz, psychedelic rock and progressive rock with an influence of music from India.

test-case.q: what do you know about forecast
test-case.a: Forecast may refer to:
The forecastle is the upper deck of a sailing ship forward of the foremast, or the forward part of a ship with the sailors' living quarters.
Forecasting is the process of making predictions of the future based on past and present data and most commonly by analysis of trends.
